Newton vs Leibniz: The calculus war classrooms never teach
description: Calculus was not born in a classroom, it was born in a fight. Isaac Newton developed fluxions in private during the plague years, while Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz published first in Acta Eruditorum and gave calculus its travelling notation. When pride entered, mathematics turned into a custody battle.

Provocateur-in-chief: How Trump's leadership differs from Obama, Reagan, or Nixon
description: That reaction itself is revealing. Trump does not see the presidency as a role shaped by inheritance, restraint, or continuity. He sees it as a personal contest, one in which dominance, visibility, and disruption are the metrics of success. To compare him with earlier presidents is therefore not just an academic exercise. It is a way of understanding how radically his leadership style departs from the American tradition.

How Logan Paul is teaching Gen Z to hustle smart
description: Gen Z faces a job market defined by uncertainty, but social media star and entrepreneur Logan Paul shows how passion can become opportunity. From building brands to investing in rare collectibles, Paul emphasizes adaptability, calculated risk, and surrounding yourself with the right people. His advice encourages young professionals to turn interests into careers and embrace unconventional paths to success.

title: Ishan Kishan to play for India in first T20I against New Zealand
Delhi pollution: GRAP IV restrictions revoked; decision after slight improvement
description: Delhi-NCR's air quality has seen improvement, leading the Commission for Air Quality Management to revoke GRAP-IV restrictions just three days after their re-imposition. While the 'severe+' category triggered the ban, stages I, II, and III of GRAP remain active.  This move offers some relief from the stringent pollution control measures.

title: UK clears construction of ‘mega’ Chinese Embassy in London, delayed over national security concerns
‘Tu kitna acha ladka hai, chhod de’: When Dev Anand gently asked Shah Rukh Khan to quit a harmful habit; expert on why quiet concern works better than warnings

NEET UG 2026 Preparation: Last 4-month blueprint to ace medical exam
Ranji Trophy: Rahul to play for Karnataka; NKR confirms availability for Andhra
description: KL Rahul will return to Ranji Trophy action for Karnataka against Punjab from January 29, while Nitish Kumar Reddy has confirmed availability for Andhra Pradesh’s remaining group games. Shubman Gill and Ravindra Jadeja are also set for domestic outings. Meanwhile, Rishabh Pant is likely to miss the second leg of the tournament due to injury and he may head to the CoE in coming days.

title: Japanese googly: More Queensland-based cricketers than Australia XI
Delhi-NCR schools shift to hybrid mode as GRAP implemented
‘Just see the exploitation’: Supreme Court to step in to curb dynamic air fares
AR Rahman children defend him amid communal remark backlash
description: Music maestro AR Rahman sparked debate with comments on Bollywood's alleged communal shift and calling 'Chhaava' divisive. Amidst online backlash, his children, Ameen, Khatija, and Raheema, rallied in support, highlighting his global achievements and integrity. Rahman clarified his views on the film and his career trajectory.

title: Another reason ‘why Greenland ​has to be acquired’: Trump slams UK’s Chagos island deal
This is how hackers can hijack your earbuds to spy on you
Trump threatens Greenland: Europe's leaders turn to Group Chat; 'Washington Group' born
description: European leaders are using a private messaging app to swiftly coordinate responses to President Trump's escalating threats, particularly concerning Greenland. This informal "Washington Group," including top officials from the UK, France, Germany, and Italy, has become vital for navigating transatlantic tensions.

title: Haryana issues notification allowing ‘kirpan’, ‘mangalsutra’ in examination halls, issues guidelines

Australian Open 2026: Carlos Alcaraz’s serve gets a Novak Djokovic upgrade at Melbourne Park
Nearly 5,800 ticketless commuters caught in 12-hour Central Railway crackdown
China criticises US tariffs at World Economic Forum; promises wider opening of economy
description: China used its platform at the World Economic Forum in Davos to warn that trade and tariff wars help no one and risk deepening global economic tensions. Vice-Premier He Lifeng called for cooperation over isolation, saying China would open its economy further and focus on boosting domestic demand, even as global trade disputes escalate under US President Donald Trump’s expanded tariff policies.

IND vs NZ 1st T20 VCA Stadium Nagpur Pitch Report: IND vs NZ Match Nagpur Weather Forecast and Updates
Dhoom actress Rimi Sen now real estate agent in Dubai goes viral
description: Actress Rimi Sen, known for hits like 'Dhoom', has transitioned to real estate in Dubai. She praised Dubai's welcoming environment and business-friendly policies, contrasting them with India's complexities. Sen also addressed plastic surgery rumors, clarifying she's only had fillers and botox, and expressed openness to facelifts post-50.

title: In justifying Greenland bid, why Trump cited the Indian Ocean island of Diego Garcia

Ice hockey trials held on rough tiles; ‘shocked’ HC stays Maharashtra’s Khelo India Winter Games selection
The new H-1B map: Where America pays global talent and where it quietly doesn’t
description: A year after Donald Trump’s return to office, the H-1B visa is no longer a uniform national pathway. Using US Department of Labor data analysed by Manifest Law, this story maps how sharply H-1B wages now diverge by city—turning geography into destiny, reshaping leverage for workers, and creating unequal outcomes, especially for Indian professionals navigating America’s talent economy.

title: Arson, violence, internet snapped: Assam’s Kokrajhar on edge after tensions between Bodos, Adivasis

DC vs MI LIVE Score, WPL 2026: Jemimah Rodrigues’ half century guides Delhi Capitals to 7-wicket win over Mumbai Indians
'Jana Nayagan' censor row: Madras HC reserves order on CBFC process
description: Madras High Court reserved its order on the 'Jana Nayagan' censorship row after a five-hour hearing. The court examined if the CBFC followed procedures when issuing and withdrawing film certification. Arguments focused on whether producers had adequate response time and if the board could revoke an initial decision. The outcome awaits the court's decision.

DKS' brother namedrops Rahul in CM row; Sidda puts it to 'high command’
description: Speculation over the Karnataka chief minister post continues. DK Shivakumar's brother said that Rahul Gandhi assured a decision would be made  at an "appropriate time". Shivakumar is reportedly exercising restraint for party unity. The upcoming legislative session may offer clarity. Meanwhile, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah remains open to discussions in New Delhi.

Two exhibitions in Delhi trace the artistic journey of Seema Kohli
UPSC Prelims 2026 CSAT Preparation Tips: Why early CSAT preparation is crucial despite delayed notification
India's trailblazer: From Sania mix-ups to sporting immortality - farewell Nehwal
description: Indian badminton icon Saina Nehwal has officially retired at 35, concluding a storied career marked by numerous firsts.  She became the first Indian woman to win an Olympic medal in badminton, achieve World No. 1 ranking, and reach the BWF World Championship final.  Her grit popularised the sport, inspiring a generation.

Why South Western Railway has scrapped 87-km Mysuru–Kushalnagar line
'I don't care about Nobel Prize': Trump breaks silence on letter to Norway PM
description: President Trump declared he no longer cares about the Nobel Prize after not receiving it, despite previously campaigning for it. He also stated he no longer feels obligated to "think purely of Peace" regarding Greenland, questioning Denmark's ownership and demanding NATO support for U.S. control of the territory.

Maharashtra CET Cell launches district outreach to boost awareness of entrance exams
Palash Muchhal shares first announcement after cancelled wedding with Smriti Mandhana, shooting to commence soon
'Great stupidity': After Greenland, Trump eyes Diego Garcia; why it matters to India
description: President Trump's criticism of the UK potentially returning Diego Garcia to Mauritius, a move backed by India, has escalated. This island hosts a vital US military base. India, with its own security interests in the Indian Ocean and historical ties to Mauritius, is supporting the decolonization process, offering significant aid for the archipelago's development.

title: Sulaiman Khan Ghori exit: Engineer leaves xAI after podcast; sparks firing speculation
description: Former xAI engineer Sulaiman Khan Ghori has departed the company, sparking speculation he was "fired" for being "too candid" during a podcast interview. Ghori discussed xAI's rapid development, novel architectures like "Macro Hard," and innovative deployment strategies, including using Tesla computers for "human emulators."

title: Maggi packets, veggies, LPG cylinders: JeM’s winter bunker in J&K; terrorists stocked up for months
description: A Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammad terror hideout, stocked for months, was busted by the army in Kishtwar's high mountains. The intense operation resulted in the supreme sacrifice of one commando and injuries to several others. Security forces continue to comb the area following the discovery.

title: Stock market crash: Nifty50 ends below 25,250; BSE Sensex down over 1,000 points - top reasons
description: Stock market crash today: Indian stock markets, Nifty50 and Sensex, experienced a significant crash today, driven by a sharp selloff in technology stocks amidst uneven earnings and global trade uncertainties. Foreign investors continued their selling spree, while gold and silver prices surged, signaling a clear shift towards risk aversion among investors seeking safe havens.

title: John Harbaugh’s wife Ingrid turns heads during Giants’ headline-making entrance
description: John Harbaugh’s arrival marks a defining shift for the New York Giants as the franchise embraces experience and stability. After nearly two decades in Baltimore, Harbaugh steps into New York with renewed purpose, supported by his family and a young, promising roster, fueling optimism about a disciplined rebuild and a competitive future.

title: Crash on 90-degree road: How civic neglect killed techie in 'planned' Noida
description: The heartbreaking drowning of a software engineer in an overflown, decade-old trench underscores a serious lapse in stormwater management over the years. Although funding and blueprints were set in 2015 to build a vital water-diverting regulator for the Hindon River, this life-saving project has yet to materialize, leading to devastating flooding that has affected numerous housing developments.

title: Noida techie death: Trucker rammed into same boundary wall 10 days ago; yet no repair
description: A 27-year-old software engineer tragically drowned after his SUV plunged into a deep, water-filled pit in Noida's Sector 150. The same damaged wall had been hit by a truck just days prior. Despite repeated warnings and a prior incident, no repairs were made, sparking outrage and administrative action.

title: Matthew Stafford’s family turns heads in Chicago with matching Rams style
description: Matthew Stafford and the Los Angeles Rams braved snowy Chicago for an NFC clash against the Bears. Despite an MVP-worthy season with 4,707 yards and 46 touchdowns, Stafford has never won the award. His wife Kelly and their four daughters cheered him on in matching custom Rams jackets, highlighting their family support as Stafford pursues his second Super Bowl in his 17th NFL season.

title: Shane Lowry’s net worth: The relentless rise of Ireland’s major champion
description: Shane Lowry's career is a testament to hard work, patience, and clutch performances. From an amateur Irish Open win to lifting The Open Championship trophy, he has become a reliable force on both the PGA Tour and DP World Tour. His consistent success, including recent strong showings and a record-tying 62, underscores his enduring talent and dedication.
